title: CMS Certification Numbers
text:
Preface
This is a Quarto book.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 1  Introduction
text:
1.1 Canonical Format
A CMS Certification Number is a uniform way of identifying a healthcare provider or supplier that has or currently does participate in the Medicare and/or Medicaid programs.
The CCN is used to track provider agreements and cost reports. The NPI1 and PTAN2 are tied to an entity’s CCN. The RO3, not the SA4 or MAC5, assigns the CCN and maintains adequate controls.
A canonically valid CCN is an alphanumeric string, either 6 or 10 characters in length, that encodes a provider/supplier’s state and facility type.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
1.2 CMS State Codes
The first two characters of the CCN represent the state in which the provider or supplier is located.

title: Providers
text:
Facility Ranges
CCNs for Providers and Suppliers paid under Medicare Part A have 6 digits. The first two characters represent the state and the last four characters represent the facility type and a unique identifier.
The last four characters of a Provider CCN represent the facility type and a unique identifier. The facility type is encoded in the third character of the last four characters. The table below summarizes the valid facility type codes and their corresponding ranges.
abbr
      desc
      range
    


ADH
Alcohol-Drug Hospital (Retired)
1200-1224


CAH
Critical Access Hospital
1300-1399

Children's Hospital
3300-3399

Community Mental Health Center, Community Mental Health Center, Community Mental Health Center
1400-1499, 4600-4799, 4900-4999

title: 2  OPOs
text:
Organ procurement organizations (OPOs) are assigned a 6-digit alphanumeric CCN. The first 2 digits identify the State code. The third digit is the alpha character P. The remaining 3 digits are the unique facility identifier.

organ("05P001")

<ccn::Organ>
 @ ccn  : chr "05P001"
 @ state: <ccn::State>
 .. @ abbr  : chr "CA"
 .. @ name  : chr "California"
 .. @ region: chr "IX"
 .. @ office: chr "San Francisco"
 @ range: chr "001-099"
 @ type : <ccn::Type>
 .. @ abbr: chr "OPO"
 .. @ desc: chr "Organ Procurement Organization"

title: 3  Emergency Hospitals
text:
3.1 Example
CCNs assigned to Emergency Hospitals (both Federal and non-Federal) that do not participate in the Medicare program.
Emergency hospitals are identified by a 6-position alphanumeric CCN. Positions one and two identify the state in which the hospital is located. Position six, an alpha character, identifies whether the hospital is Federal (F) or non-Federal (E). Positions three, four and five represent a sequence beginning with 001. This sequence identifies the order, by state, in which the CCN was issued.
For example, the CCN of the 34th emergency hospital in Maryland would be 21034E. The Regional Office assigns the CCN in strict numerical sequence without regard to the Federal or non-Federal status.
parse("21034E")

<parsed:emergency>


     ccn: 21034E
   state: 21
sequence: 034
    type: E

decode("12345F")

<ccn::Emergency>
 @ ccn  : chr "12345F"
 @ state: <ccn::State>
 .. @ abbr  : chr "HI"
 .. @ name  : chr "Hawaii"
 .. @ region: chr "IX"
 .. @ office: chr "San Francisco"
 @ range: chr "001-999"
 @ type : <ccn::Type>
 .. @ abbr: chr "F"
 .. @ desc: chr "Federal"

data_frame("11038F") # USAF Hospital (Moody)

     ccn             entity        state       region   range eipps        type
1 11038F Emergency Hospital GA (Georgia) IV (Atlanta) 001-999    NA F (Federal)
  parent  ext
1   <NA> <NA>

title: Medicaid-Only Providers
text:
Facility Types
Title XIX-only providers are identified by a 6-position alphanumeric CCN. Positions one and two identify the state in which the provider is located. Position three, an alpha character, identifies the type of facility, by either level or type of care being provided. Positions four, five and six represent a sequence beginning with 001.
The third character of a Medicaid-Only Provider CCN represents the facility type and a unique identifier. The facility type is encoded in the third character of the last four characters. The table below summarizes the valid facility type codes and their corresponding ranges.
abbr
      desc
      code
    


HHA
Home Health Agency
K


ICF-IID
Intermediate Care Facility for Individuals with Intellectual Disabilities
G, H


MOH
Medicaid-Only Hospital
J


NF
Nursing Facility
A, B, E, F


PRTF
Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility
L

title: 9  Hospitals
Suppliers
text:
Suppliers that are paid by Part B carriers have a 10-digit alphanumeric CCN. The first 2 digits identify the State in which the supplier is located. The third digit is an alpha character that identifies the type of facility. The remaining 7 digits are the unique facility identifier.
The following characters in the third position indicate:


C [ASC]: Ambulatory Surgical Centers

D [CLIA]: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988 (CLIA) Laboratories

X [PXRF]: Portable X-Ray Facilities

The last 7 digits of the CCN for the above suppliers will be within the number series 0000001-9999999.

ccn:::get_pin("asc")

# A tibble: 5,536 × 3
   ccn        state facility_name                                 
   <chr>      <chr> <chr>                                         
 1 05C0001831 CA    THE SURGERY CENTER AT NORTHBAY VACA VALLEY    
 2 05C0001873 CA    CARLSBAD SURGERY CENTER LLC                   
 3 14C0001134 IL    MIDWEST ENDOSCOPY CENTER LLC                  
 4 19C0001115 LA    ADVANCED SURGICAL CARE OF BATON ROUGE LLC     
 5 19C0001088 LA    ENDO CENTER LLC                               
 6 36C0001248 OH    WASC LLC DBA WOOSTER AMBULATORY SURGERY CENTER
 7 36C0001267 OH    NEW ALBANY SURGERY CENTER LLC                 
 8 26C0001033 MO    CITY PL SURGERY CENTER                        
 9 31C0001270 NJ    NORTHERN NJ ENDOSCOPY CENTER LLC              
10 46C0001039 UT    MOUNTAIN WEST SURGERY CENTER LLC              
# ℹ 5,526 more rows
